headline.print_headline: Romney Energy Plan Would Expand Oil Drilling on U.S. Land and Offshore
headline.seo: Romney Energy Plan Would Expand Oil Drilling Offshore
headline.main: Romney Energy Plan Would Expand Oil Drilling on U.S. Land and Offshore

docs.snippet: Mr. Romney’s plan would give states more control over drilling on federal land, promote the nuclear power industry and approve an oil pipeline from Canada....
docs.abstract: Mitt Romney plans to unveil an energy plan that allows states more control over the development of energy resources on federal lands within their borders; proposal, which is likely to be controversial among environmentalists, would also aggressively expand offshore oil and gas drilling as part of a broader effort to reach energy independence.

byline.original: By CLIFFORD KRAUSS and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss reported from Houston, and Ashley Parker from Bettendorf, Iowa.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Romney’s plan would give states more control over drilling on federal land, promote the nuclear power industry and approve an oil pipeline from Canada.

headline.print_headline: Signs of Revival, Slight but Sure, For Home Sales
headline.seo: Housing Report Continues Signs of Weak Revival
headline.main: Signs of Revival, Slight but Sure, for Home Sales

docs.snippet: Sales of existing homes were up in July, continuing a trend of several months that real estate agents said was good news for the housing market....
docs.abstract: National Association of Realtors reports sales of existing homes rose 2.3 percent in July from June, continuing a trend of several months that real estate agents say is good news for the housing market; nascent recovery is still a convalescent one, with the pace of activity uneven and far below the levels reached before the bubble burst; home prices remain under pressure in many markets.

byline.original: By SHAILA DEWAN and NELSON D. SCHWARTZ

docs.lead_paragraph: Sales of existing homes were up in July, continuing a trend of several months that real estate agents said was good news for the housing market.

headline.print_headline: Luxury Home Builder Reports a Revenue Gain of 41%
headline.seo: Toll Brothers Reports Revenue Gain of 41%
headline.main: Luxury Home Builder Reports a Revenue Gain of 41%

docs.snippet: Postrecession growth at Toll Brothers, the largest luxury home builder in the United States, underlines the recovery in the housing market....
docs.abstract: Postrecession growth at Toll Brothers, the largest luxury home builder in the United States, underlines the recovery in the housing market; it reports fiscal third-quarter profit of $61.6 million, or 36 cents a share, up from $42.1 million, or 25 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter; revenue rose 41 percent to $554.3 million from $394.3 million.
docs.lead_paragraph: Postrecession growth at Toll Brothers, the largest luxury home builder in the United States, underlines the recovery in the housing market.

headline.print_headline: Panel Wants Former Judge In Syracuse Kept Off Bench
headline.seo: Panel Wants Ex-Judge in Syracuse Barred From Bench Over Sex Misconduct Case
headline.main: Panel Wants Former Judge in Syracuse Kept Off Bench

docs.snippet: The State Commission on Judicial Conduct ruled against a former family court judge who admitted having an encounter 40 years ago with his then-5-year-old niece....
docs.abstract: New York State Commission on Judicial Conduct rules against former Syracuse family court judge Bryan R Hedges, who admitted to having a sexual encounter 40 years ago with his then-5-year-old niece, saying he should be barred from returning to the bench.
docs.lead_paragraph: The State Commission on Judicial Conduct ruled against a former family court judge who admitted having an encounter 40 years ago with his then-5-year-old niece.

headline.print_headline: A Lemon Grower Emphasizes Citrus Uses Outside the Kitchen
headline.seo: For Limoneira’s Lemons, Promoting Applications Outside the Kitchen
headline.main: A Lemon Grower Emphasizes Uses for Citrus Outside the Kitchen

docs.snippet: Limoneira strives to promote other uses for its lemons, be it in beauty, health, lifestyle or cleaning....
docs.abstract: Andrew Adam Newman Advertising column highlights campaign by California lemon grower Limoneira which emphasizes citrus uses outside the kitchen.
docs.lead_paragraph: Limoneira strives to promote other uses for its lemons, be it in beauty, health, lifestyle or cleaning.

headline.print_headline: Indiana: Guards and Prisoners Face Drug-Ring Charges
headline.seo: Guards and Prisoners Face Drug-Ring Charges
headline.main: Indiana: Guards and Prisoners Face Drug-Ring Charges

docs.snippet: A federal indictment says 40 people face charges in a methamphetamine ring that was run from at least two Indiana prisons with the help of corrections officers....
docs.abstract: Federal indictment says 40 people face charges in a methamphetamine ring that was run from at least two Indiana prisons with the help of corrections officers.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal indictment says 40 people face charges in a methamphetamine ring that was run from at least two Indiana prisons with the help of corrections officers.

headline.print_headline: Hoping to Get Lucky Again in the Travers
headline.seo: In Travers Stakes, Trainer Contessa Takes a Shot
headline.main: Hoping to Get Lucky Again in the Travers

docs.snippet: Gary Contessa, who in 1981 walked the upset winner Willow Hour to the summer’s marquee event at the Saratoga Race Course, has entered Speightscity, a 30-1 dark horse, this year....
docs.abstract: Postcards from Saratoga; horse trainer Gary Contessa enters 30-1 dark horse Speightscity in the Travers Stakes, the summer's marquee event at the Saratoga Race Course.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gary Contessa, who in 1981 walked the upset winner Willow Hour to the summer’s marquee event at the Saratoga Race Course, has entered Speightscity, a 30-1 dark horse, this year.

headline.print_headline: Man Indicted In Shooting at Lobbyists’ Headquarters
headline.seo: Man Indicted in Shooting at Headquarters of Lobbyists
headline.main: Man Indicted In Shooting at Lobbyists’ Headquarters

docs.snippet: A Virginia man opposed to the politics of a conservative lobbying group was indicted Wednesday in the shooting of a security guard....
docs.abstract: Floyd Lee Corkins II, Virginia man opposed to the politics of conservative lobbying group the Family Research Council, is indicted in the shooting of a security guard at group’s Washington headquarters.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Virginia man opposed to the politics of a conservative lobbying group was indicted Wednesday in the shooting of a security guard.

docs.snippet: The Greek company Korres has infused its new mascara with minerals derived from volcanic soil and other beauty related news....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Greek company Korres has infused its new mascara with minerals derived from volcanic soil and other beauty related news.

headline.print_headline: Changes to Money Market Funds Stall
headline.main: Changes to Money Market Funds Stall

docs.snippet: Attempts to make sweeping changes to money-market mutual funds, which played a destabilizing role in the 2008 financial crisis, have been derailed....
docs.abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission holds up a vote on proposed sweeping changes to regulating money-market mutual funds; three of the five commissioners oppose plan by chairwoman Mary L Schapiro; decision is a short-term victory for the financial industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: Attempts to make sweeping changes to money-market mutual funds, which played a destabilizing role in the 2008 financial crisis, have been derailed.
